item.title:
As catch amounts increase, we are freeing up space on our vessels by changing how we weigh and organize our catch.
Fibrous plastics will now be weighed after returning to shore, so we'll be reporting provisional amounts before confirming the verified quantities later. https://t.co/dWAy6eyc7w

item.title: This project started as a conversation between @abigails_greene , @coreyhorien, and I about ‚Äúbrain state.‚Äù We each use this term in descriptions of our research ranging from whole-brain fMRI in patient populations (Abby, Corey) to cell- and circuit-level recordings in mice (me).
item.description: This project started as a conversation between @abigails_greene , @coreyhorien, and I about ‚Äúbrain state.‚Äù We each use this term in descriptions of our research ranging from whole-brain fMRI in patient populations (Abby, Corey) to cell- and circuit-level recordings in mice (me).
item.content:encoded: This project started as a conversation between @abigails_greene , @coreyhorien, and I about ‚Äúbrain state.‚Äù We each use this term in descriptions of our research ranging from whole-brain fMRI in patient populations (Abby, Corey) to cell- and circuit-level recordings in mice (me).

item.title: We wondered if there was anything in common between what each of us was referring to as a ‚Äúbrain state.‚Äù And does it actually matter?

item.title: What emerged was a roadmap for collaboration that we intend to follow in our future work and a guide for the principled use of ‚Äúbrain state‚Äù in both the planning and interpretation of experiments.
